entries.title: Seamless Checkout, AI, Robotics News From Microsoft, Google, Brain Corp And More At NRF 2023
entries.description: Vice President and Principal Analyst Melody Brue looks at some of the companies and products showcased at NRF 2023 that maximize the three pillars of an excellent shopping experience.

entries.title: Why Would We Need A Geospatial Strategy Anyway?
entries.description: At the center of important decisions for companies today is a geographic approach at every level. Not just as data points on a map, but as a framework for the entire enterprise. Leaders are using GIS to answer questions critical to operating a sustainable, profitable business.

entries.title: Elevance Health To Buy Louisiana Blue Cross Plan
entries.description: Elevance Health will buy Blue Cross and Blue Shield of Louisiana, adding to its family of Anthem Blue Cross plans in 14 other states.

entries.title: Latest Google Leak Reveals Pixel Fold Decisions
entries.description: A key decision around the form factor of Google's upcoming Pixel Fold has leaked.

entries.title: A Psychologist Offers 3 Tips To Help You Ditch Passive-Aggressive Tendencies
entries.description: Caught up in an anger-laden situation? Here are a few win-win ways to go about it.

entries.title: Apple iOS 16.3 Is Here: Urgent iPhone Upgrade With Vital Fixes
entries.description: The next iOS software is here, with a release earlier than expected.

entries.title: Two Warnings About These ‘Forspoken’ Reviews
entries.description: Forspoken review scores are in and they're pretty bad, but I think the game is even worse than reviewers give it credit for.

entries.title: 16 Ways Teachers, Parents And Communities Can Leverage Tech To Improve Educational Outcomes
entries.description: Technology can provide valuable tools to help students learn using the platforms and methods they already use and best understand—tools that can genuinely capture their interest.

entries.title: MIT/IEEE-Published Study Falsely Imagines Computing In Robocars Will Emit Lots Of Carbon.  Relax, It’s Unlikely.
entries.description: Researchers suggested future self-driving cars might draw huge amounts of power to run their computers, and contribute to global warming.  It's not true, both because such power use is unlikely, and because robocars will use green power even when the grid still has lots of fossil

entries.title: A First Chat With New Infoblox President And CEO Scott Harrel
entries.description: #1-Ranked Industry analyst Patrick Moorhead dives in as Scott Harrell is the new CEO of Infoblox following the retirement of Jesper Andersen. Before joining Infoblox, Scott was the Senior Vice President and General Manager for Cisco.

entries.title: Every MacBook Pro Review Offers The Same Warning
entries.description: There's just one thing everyone wants you to know about Apple's new MacBook Pro...

entries.title: Beer Brands Focus On Sustainability To build Trust With Consumers
entries.description: Brewing is a hugely competitive industry that is facing a plethora of environmental and social challenges. Brewers are responding to the challenge with a range of strategies to win trust and boost transparency, from clean energy-powered breweries to tree planting.

entries.title: OnePlus Buds Pro 2 To Have Two Stand-Out Features
entries.description: OnePlus is gearing up to launch its first flagship of 2023. The February 7 launch will also see the global unveiling of the OnePlus Buds Pro 2.

entries.title: mRNA Covid Shots Safe And Effective In Children Ages 5-11, Large Study Finds—Though Vaccine Uptake Remains Low
entries.description: One doctor said the study presents data showing parents that “the decision to vaccinate their children should be an easy one” and that the risk of serious side effects like myocarditis is “miniscule.”

entries.title: Perimenopause Could Be A Risky Phase For Developing Eating Disorders
entries.description: A recent study published in the journal Menopause found that women can experience body dissatisfaction during perimenopause and that could make them more vulnerable to develop eating disorders.

entries.title: ESL And Rennsport Reveal Inaugural Racing Esports Tournament For 2022
entries.description: Esports giants and factory teams alike will face off in Rennsport, with a prize pool of $500,000 at stake.

entries.title: 343 Needs To Answer Just One ‘Halo’ Question: What Is Master Chief Doing Next?
entries.description: From the launch of Halo Infinite, meant to be a “platform” for a generation of Halo content, there have been two main questions.

entries.title: HR Company Deel, Now Valued At $12 Billion, Nears $300 Million Of Revenue
entries.description: The HR fintech company is also unveiling new HR software to compete with rivals like Rippling — and giving it away for free.

entries.title: How ChatGPT Suddenly Became Google’s Code Red, Prompting Return Of Page And Brin
entries.description: The new kid on the A.I. block, ChatGPT, has shaken up Google.

entries.title: Inside The Fence: Automated Trucking Gains Momentum With Outrider’s $73M Series C Fundraise
entries.description: Outrider’s $73M Series C fundraise promises to expand automated trucking within a little-known aspect of logistics: yard trucks. This will enable deployment of hundreds of electric automated vehicles to customer sites, according to the company.

entries.title: A Psychologist Explains What A Drug-Free Psychedelic Experience Can Look And Feel Like
entries.description: It’s time we dispelled the mystery around the mystical phenomenon of spontaneous spiritual awakenings.

entries.title: After Blues, Five More ‘Destiny 2’ Quality Of Life Gripes To Fix
entries.description: Here are five minor gripes that have been plaguing Destiny 2 for a long while now that could use some fixing.

entries.title: ChatGPT Parent Open AI Gets ‘Game Changing’ Multibillion-Dollar Boost From Microsoft
entries.description: It’s a $10 billion dollar investment, according to Bloomberg, as the Washington-based tech giant deepens its commitment to the viral artificial intelligence chatbot.

entries.title: New Predictions From CloudQuant’s Alternative Data Crystal Ball
entries.description: Inflation is still on the minds of consumers and now the tech sector is laying off employees like tax accountants after tax season. We check in with the indomitable Morgan Slade, the head sage of CloudQuant to see what insights his data science team have discovered since last month.

entries.title: Fortnite’s The Kid LAROI Project Is A Creative Island, Not A Full Concert
entries.description: Some leaks implied that at long last, Fortnite would be getting a new performance on the map from a new artist, rapper The Kid LAROI, but it’s…not going to be quite at Ariana’s level.

entries.title: ‘Forspoken’ PS5 Reviews Are Here, And They Are Bad
entries.description: As I said previously, red flags have been going up about Square Enix’s Forspoken left and right as of late. The demo was not terribly well-received and needed its own patch before release. The PC specs of the game were ludicrous. The dialogue in the trailers felt cringe-worthy.

entries.title: ‘The Last Of Us’ Explains Why Netflix’s Binge Drop Shows Don’t Land As Hard
entries.description: Why weekly shows like The Last of Us hit hard while Netflix's mass binge content does not.

entries.title: See The Giraffe-Sized Asteroid Found On Saturday Whizz Scary Close To Earth On Thursday
entries.description: The just-found near-Earth asteroid 2023 will be the fourth-closest detected pass on record.

entries.title: Apple Mac mini 2023 Review: The M2 mini Is The Go-To Great-Value Mac
entries.description: If you want a Mac but are on a budget, this could be the best choice.

entries.title: Why People Skills—Not Industry Experience—Are The Most Important Prerequisite For New Cybersecurity Hires
entries.description: A good IT person can only make good recommendations when they understand the company's objectives and avoid working in a silo. That understanding of the big picture leads to innovation and system and process improvements.

entries.title: How Collaborative Social Impact Programs Are Empowering The Workforce
entries.description: Collaboration between public and private sectors has never been more crucial for people entering the economy. In this video, see the importance of mobilizing a community of organizations to support the UN SDGs, and to empower impact enterprises.

entries.title: Learning From The Atom-Based Quantum Computer
entries.description: The atom is the first concrete and stable structure that comprises all the complexity of quantum dynamics.

entries.title: Why Explainability Should Be The Core Of Your AI Application
entries.description: Explainable AI helps build trust in AI by providing continuous visibility into training and production models.

entries.title: Why Data Storage Is Mission Critical For The Future Of Space
entries.description: Technologies developed for space have provided earthly benefits in healthcare and other critical sectors while transforming technologies into products we use regularly.

entries.title: Reframing The Disruption Conversation: The Next Supply Chain Crisis Isn’t What You Should Focus On
entries.description: By making the right decisions today, supply chain leaders can turn enormous complexity and disruption into meaningful change.

entries.title: How Technology Can Help To Improve Hospital Food Service
entries.description: Offering an enhanced cafeteria experience for patients and their families may be a differentiator in an area where public perception often identifies a lack of quality and service.

entries.title: When Did Mammoths Go Extinct?
entries.description: The mystery surrounding the exact timing of the extinction of mammoths has long captivated paleontologists. DNA provided some answers, but a new study questions those results.

entries.title: Let’s Look At Both Sides Of The Vaccine Debate
entries.description: I keep getting into debates with people about the safety and efficacy of vaccines. Let's weigh the pluses and minuses.

entries.title: What The Metaverse Could Mean To Medical Education: A Surgeon's Perspective
entries.description: While the metaverse continues to follow a typical technology adoption curve, I believe both virtual reality and augmented reality will eventually have their place in healthcare.

entries.title: The Importance Of Digital Infrastructure In Getting To Net Zero
entries.description: The climate crisis is upon us.

entries.title: Doomsday Clock—Measuring Humanity’s Threat Of Self-Annihilation—Updates Tuesday. Here’s What To Know.
entries.description: The Doomsday Clock currently sits at 100 seconds to midnight due to the threats of climate change, nuclear war and misinformation, the closest to human annihilation it has been since its founding in the 1940s.

entries.title: The Top Three Things You Don’t Know About Cloud Optimization
entries.description: Companies that have strategic insights into their costs with better monitoring are ultimately able to make the most out of the cloud.

entries.title: How Business Leaders Can Turn The Midlife Crisis Mindset Into A Midlife Digital Awakening
entries.description: Rather than simply questioning their place in the world, many business leaders are using this time to embrace new technologies and digital transformation initiatives.

entries.title: A Murderer Targeted Pregnant Moms In A Private Facebook Group, Feds Say. Its Moderators Claim No One Told Them.
entries.description: An alleged killer joined a Facebook group for passing on kids’ items to find pregnant mothers and possibly kidnap them, according to a search warrant. Some moms in the group say neither the FBI or Meta informed them that their data was caught up in a murder investigation.

entries.title: Three Ways Businesses Can Make The Most Of Live Shopping
entries.description: As live shopping grows increasingly popular, here are three ways that businesses can take advantage of this shift.

entries.title: Understanding The Risks And Rewards Of CNAPP
entries.description: Before you embrace CNAPP, set your own priorities and determine what elements of cloud security are most important to you.

entries.title: Keychron’s S1 Mechanical Keyboard Is The Best Yet For Apple Macs
entries.description: Keychron's S1 mechanical keyboard with backlit low-profile keycaps is an ideal alternative to Apple's Magic keyboard.

entries.title: How To Manage Software Developers Who Moonlight
entries.description: The key to responsibly managing software developers who moonlight is to understand why they choose to do so in the first place.

entries.title: Microsoft Is Aggressively Investing In Healthcare AI
entries.description: Paige is the latest AI company and venture to partner with Microsoft.

entries.title: EFRAG’s SRB Vice Chair Professor Kerstin Lopatta Discusses Sustainability Reporting
entries.description: Kerstin Lopatta is an accounting professor at the University of Hamburg. She was the Acting Chair of EFRAG's Sustainability Reporting Board (SRB) and now Vice Chair and Special Liaison to the ISSB. We discuss the work of the SRB and how to align it with the ISSB. She will play a key role in this.

entries.title: OnePlus Confirms Exciting Option For Upcoming Buds Pro 2
entries.description: It's time for a new audio experience with the upcoming Buds Pro 2 from OnePlus.

entries.title: Are Compostable Bags As Environmentally Friendly As We Think They Are?
entries.description: According to research conducted by packaging platform Sourceful, only 3% of compostable packaging in the U.K. ends up in a proper composting facility.

entries.title: Hyperscaler Shaker, Civo’s Lighter Touch To Heavyweight Clouds
entries.description: Now positioning its technology proposition as rather more than just a Kubernetes platform, Civo wants it to be regarded as a templatefor how modern cloud should work, with community at the heart of its culture.

entries.title: Sun Will Eventually Expand To Some 300 Times Its Current Size, Says Study
entries.description: New survey of giant stars reveals details about the Sun’s own likely endgame as an expanding red giant.

entries.title: Solar P1 Pro Review: Electric Scooter That’s Fast And Heavy
entries.description: The Solar P1 Pro is an electric scooter that  can get up to 55 miles per hour.

entries.title: How ChatGPT And Natural Language Technology Might Affect Your Job If You Are A Computer Programmer
entries.description: Artificial intelligence tools can now create not only speech and text but also computer code. Here, we look at what that might mean for coders and computer programmers.

entries.title: Refining Google With Search Gizmos To Get What You Want
entries.description: You need to dial in your search results and save time? Check out these advanced, specialized search engines, search tools.

entries.description: HBO's The Last Of Us gives us a shorter, more intense second episode with a tragic finale.

entries.title: Why Antidepressants Might Make Users Feel Emotionally Numb
entries.description: In a new study, a group of scientists found that a selective serotonin reuptake inhibitors (SSRI) can affect reinforcement learning, which refers to a person’s decision-making abilities.

entries.title: See A Crescent Moon Tangle With Saturn And Venus: The Night Sky This Week
entries.description: The celestial highlights for the week ahead.
